manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 7/8 Inch Male to 7/8 Inch Female Adapetr with Built-In Filter. Toilet Fill Valve Pipe Screen Adapter 7/8 inch male to 7/8 inch female with built-In filter. Used in a toilet system.Collect dirt, rust, or other sediment particles, etc. Used In Toilet Fill Valve The toilet water filter attaches to the bottom of 7/8 inch and 15/16 inch Toilet fill valves. Prevent the toilet fill valve from leaking due to particulate blockage. Used In Bidet Adapter Built-in filter is designed to prevent calcium buildup in appliances and Fill valves.

7/8" Toilet Fill Valve Pipe Screen Adapter If you see toilet sand, dirt, rust or other sediment particles collecting in the bottom of your tank, then this screen filter is the solution. Our toilet and bidet filter only captures particles and does not treat water conditions such as hardness, silt, discoloration or staining.Package include: 7/8 toilet filter screen adapter x 2, Cone washer for 7 / 8 toilet connection x 2.

7/8" Toilet Fill Valve Pipe Screen Adapter If you see toilet sand, dirt, rust or other sediment particles collecting in the bottom of your tank, then this screen filter is the solution. Our toilet and bidet filter only captures particles and does not treat water conditions such as hardness, silt, discoloration or staining.Package include: 7/8 toilet filter screen adapter x 2, Cone washer for 7 / 8 toilet connection x 2.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well Made, Easy Install, and Best of All, Cheap
reviews.reviewText: I recently replaced an older Toto washlet with a newer model. Surprisingly, while the old Toto washlet had a filter screen to trap sediment from the water line, the new one does not. So, I purchased this. It is a very easy install. It has a decent size filter. The screen is the right size. It will eliminate sediment, but it is not so fine that it will clog easily. I actually installed this on the inlet water line so that both the toilet and washlet water will be filtered. I am guessing that cleaning it about once a year will be about right.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install and maintain. Works perfectly.
reviews.reviewText: In my house I have galvanized metal pipes that spit out debris into the water flow on a regular basis. After every main line shut off there was a risk to have some valves dead. Recently, there was a work done on the pipes, and all valves in the hose gone dead. I replaced them, but as the work continued two new died pretty quick. This filter was a lifesaver. Very easy to install (2 mins at max). Simple in maintenance: just unscrew (no tools needed), wash, and place back.Also, I have to say I was a bit skeptical about the filter design. However, practice proved the solution was right: as the debris accumulate, it gathers at the filter perimeter. This way the debris doesn't block the direct flow. Of course, you need to keep the process under control and do a periodical cleanup. Otherwise, the filter will get clogged eventually.On the photo is a demonstration of how much debris this filter can caught without getting clogged. I had a main line works in the house. Imagine what would happen to the valves if I didn't have the filter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect Fix for Sediment Issues
reviews.reviewText: I've had continuing issues with sediment from my well despite having a whole house water filter. This has caused multiple issues with the fill valves in my toilets so I decided to try this in-line filter when replacing a toilet. It was very easy to install and is filtering sediment as expected. I will have to clean it at some point, but it will not be very difficult as removal, cleaning and re-installation are straightforward and simple. Recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You can reverse the inline filter mesh.
reviews.reviewText: Yes, that's right... You can reverse the inline filter mesh.We has a soft water system break and it spilled 2 million micro-resin balls in my plumbing... :(I have been unclogging showerheads, faucets and toilets for weeks.Toilets are a little more complicated to clean up, it either plugs up or never stops dribbling water overfilling the tank and you have to fully disassemble to clean them up.These inline filters are well made and the stainless mesh is a fine grade.It screws inline with your water inlet as a perfect match.► Pro-Tip: If you attach a flex hose to your toilet water inlet, the filter can be pointed downwards as it usually comes.... but if you use a hard / flexible metal tubing, you can reverse the filter and point it upwards so the filter goes inside you toilet valve riser with room to spare.... filter effect is the same but it leaves more room for the hard tube water inlet to go in from the bottom and not touch the filter.This will solve my micro-brad resin issue once and for all... and even if it packs itself solid of debris, it is easier to clean up that disassemble the toilet fill valve daily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2022
reviews.reviewText: These work like a champ. Perfect size!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very easy to install
reviews.reviewText: I have been thinking for a long time about making something to screen the particles going into the toilet.All you have to do is disconnect the supply line under the toilet tank, screw the filter on and reconnect the supply line back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This item works perfectly. It stopped the well water sediments from getting into my toilets & messing them up. I would definitely recommend this item

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don't Buy This One!
reviews.reviewText: This item came with no instructions. And as you see in the pictures, the filter is flipped both ways. When I asked how to install it they just copied and pasted what's in the description. That's an incomplete thought process, so does NOT actually tell you how to install it. Purchase something better than this. Or find this item being sold from another seller.
Très utile et facile à installer
